Olivia "Olive" Armstrong. Short black hair, dusky complexion. She's not especially attractive. She loves digging, and is almost certain to have some form of grime on her at any given moment. She's extremely hardy, and loves what she considers "treasure" - even if said treasure is someone else's trash. (Think Rena from "When the Cicadas Cry".)

Is this you?
14121.title: Olivia Armstrong

141211.content:
Public Park, 10:30 AM, Sunday

Olivia dug her shovel into the ground once again, relishing the satisfaction that comes with physical exhaustion. She wiped her forehead relatively clean of sweat with a sleeve, and dug her shovel in again, only to stop as she hit something besides dirt.

It didn’t feel like rock – it was too smooth. She cleared away the dirt on top of it, and picked it up. It was a book.

What kind of person would just bury a book like that? Olivia had no idea, but decided to take a rest as she perused its contents.

Wouldn’t you know it? The pages were all blank. Olivia sighed, when a voice echoed, “See first page.” “Hello?” Olivia yelled. “Who said that?”

“Who said what, Olivia?” asked a passerby. Olivia was something of a celebrity in her neighborhood for being a digging freak.

“Oh… nothing,” Olivia said. It probably wasn’t worth pursuing anyway. She took a look at the first page, and saw these words: “Congratulations on becoming the master of this book! Anything the master writes in these pages becomes reality. ONLY the master can write in this book – any other writers will have their ink sucked into the page unless the master specifically writes their permission into the same page. This book cannot be destroyed except by its current master. It cannot leave the master unless the master dies or relinquishes mastership. Have fun!”

Olivia was at a loss for words. This book… this book was capable of altering reality? She just couldn’t believe it. It was worth a test… but she didn’t have anything to write with on hand. She quickly climbed up the hole with the book in her arms, went home, and borrowed a pencil.

She holed up in her room, sucking on the eraser of the pencil and wondering what to write…
141211.title: Digger

1412111.content:
Olivia's Room, 10:45 AM.

Olivia decided to write: "In the park, the hole I just dug will refill itself, repairing the ground as though I had never dug it. No one will remember about the hole." She took the book with her, and the pencil, as she ran back to the park.

Sure enough, the hole wasn't there anymore. When Olivia asked someone about it, they had no idea what she was talking about.

Olivia's mind raced with excitement. She could do this, make that, and destroy the other utterly. She could... well, she should probably get her own thoughts under control first. She sat down near the fountain in the park and sucked on the eraser yet again.
1412111.title: A big... underground lair!

14121111.content: How should she enhance her body?
14121111.title: How?

141211111.content:
Olivia randomly decided to write, "My strength is multiplied by one hundred, without any muscle growth or body structure change." She figured that if she had to play around with fire, she should wear fireproof clothes.

She felt a tingling all over her body, but felt no appreciable effect. This was probably natural, because she was sitting down. She stood up, and was amazed at how light her body felt. She felt great... no, she felt super. She felt like she could dig any distance, no problem... which she probably could. Of course, she'd have to eat, sleep, go to the bathroom, et cetera...

Olivia grinned at the idea she had. She wrote, "I do not need to eat, sleep, breathe, or go to the bathroom. My skin is absolutely unpierceable, I do not age, my body neutralizes poison and disease, I am completely acid-proof, fire-proof, and electricity-proof, and I do not feel pain from anything that does not put my body in danger."

Again, she felt a tingling all over her body. This time, it lasted a lot longer, and she could also feel it inside her. The feeling made her shiver.

"Oh," she said, as she remembered that you could die from internal bleeding. She wrote, "My body automatically reverses all internal injuries it receives."

Now the ideas were flooding her mind. She decided to write, "I do not forget anything" in the book. She then wrote, "I do not get the 'bends' from diving too deep. My nervous system is completely indestructible. My thought speed is ten times faster than a supercomputer." She couldn't write fast enough to get all the ideas on paper, especially after that last one.

Finally, her pencil broke.

Olivia looked dumbly at the broken stump. She could probably still write with the broken-off tip, but it might be better to borrow someone else's writing device.

What was she to do?
141211111.title: Olivia, Super-Strong

14411.content:
It was saturday morning at the neighborhood park.

Birds are chirping.

The sun is shining high in the sky.

People doing their own thing.

And you are bored as hell.

But that is to be expected, since nothing interesting actually happens around here.

Day after day is the same dull routine: get up, go to school, go home, do homework, and go to bed.

Yeah, that's life.

You look up into the sky and thought, "I wish something interesting would happen to me?"

"GRANTED!"

You didn't get time to respond before something hard hit you in the back of the head.

"OUCH!" You exclaim in pain, rubbing the back of your head to ease the stinging sensation. You look behind you to see what hit you, only to find a blue notebook.

Normally, you would chuck the damn thing back at whoever threw it to you, but a quick glance show no one within throwing distance to even get a clear shot at you. Grumbling you pick up the notebook and decide to see what's inside.

You see a message on the front page,

"CONGRADULATIONS (Insert name here)! You have been chosen by the gods of chaos to have the power over reality in your grubby little hands. Whatever is written in this notebook actually happens in real life! Gee, isn't that swell? Just becareful, with great power comes great responsibility.....Nah, who are we kidding, do whatever ya' like! Raise some hell! Get back at the people who picked on you! Cause chaos! CREATE JETPACKS FOR ALL WE CARE! Just put this notebook to good use.

Sincerly,

The Legion of Chaos

P.S. If you wish to now more about the notebook, just write "Summon Notebook Familiar" and a representative will arrive shortly to show you the basics. Till then have fun!"

You raise and eyebrow, was this some sort of prank. Sure having the power of a god in the palm of your hand is something, but seriously is this for real?

Buuuuuuuuuuuut, it wouldn't hurt to at least try it out.

But where, do you wish to start in the park where so many people can be a witness, or play it safe and go home to try it out?
14411.title: Reality Note

choices: You choose some one familiar to you.
144111.content:
'Screw caution.' You think to yourself, if someone else had this kind of power they'll abuse it the second upon receiving it. Why should you play good boy, you now have the fabric of reality in your grasp. A public park with plenty of...."willing" participants for your amusement is a good way to put this notebook to good use.

You smile, "This is going to be fun." You already have the first thing you are going to write in first in mind. You reach into your jacket pocket to pull out a pen and began writing.

"Everytime I write in the notebook, people will not pay attention to me." You write in, and immeditaly you can tell this notebook is the real deal.

As soon as you were done writing, you notice a faint glow surround you as still had the pen in contact with the notebook. You lifted the pen, and the glow fades. You place your pen to the notebook's pages and glow appears again. You repeat the process several times, and can confirm that this aura can make sure you are invisible to the human eye when you start writing in the notebook.

It was a good idea too, you don't want to be on the receiving end of someone's wraith when they find out about your fun. You wouldn't want your fun to end too soon because of a careless mistake. Besides, you can already barely surpress you slightly insane giggle from the thought of all the chaos you can raise. This notebook will defiently make life much more interesting.

Satisfy of your own safety you look around the park to find who would be your first victim, er you mean, test sub-, no, participant. You notice some people you know, and think it might be good to mess around with them. Though you can just pick some random person, just for kicks.
144111.title: Throw caution in the wind and try the notebook ...

1441112.content:
Normally, you would choose someone close to you, but hey, you have the power over reality, so you can mess with whoever you want. Now the only option is who to choose as your first guinea pig. The park was filled with so many to choose from.

You look around and notice a middle-age buisness man in a suit and tie talking over the phone. Probably to some business partner you though. The guy is a total stiff, maybe you should throw a littel chaos into his life.

Next, you see two adults, a male and a female, making out with each other. Oh, too perfect. A couple having a lovey-dovey moment, and you can royally screw it up. Oh this brings oppurtunities.

Now who should you choose.
1441112.title: You choose a random person.

14411122.content:
You decide to choose the couple, they're not doing anything important besides making out with each other, why their just asking for be the first of many to fall victim to your new found power.

You put pen to paper and soon your body is veiled in a glow signifying your invisibility to the public eye. You smile and begin to write...only one problem.

You just don't know where to start.

'Damn.' You think to yourself, pen still on the notebook. You can already think of a dozen ways to mess with the couple yet you just can't find the right one. Obviously the first test must be a real hoot, but the ideas swimming around in your head sound all so tempting. Hard decisions are annoying.

One idea is to swap the couple's genders, making the guy into a girl and give versa. You can almost imagine their faces when they notice the change.

Still, there are other possibilities...
14411122.title: Every romance must have its share of weird.

144112.content:
While it is fun to raise some chaos, just going off and messing around with people is more than likely to put yourself into some hot water. At least not without a little practice at home first.

Deciding for the best, you take the notebook and proceed back to your house, the notebook held underneath your arm to ensure it doesn't slip out.

Arriving home about ten minutes later, you notice a note on the door.

"Dear Joey,

Your father and I have left on a very important business trip and won't be back for some time. Your Uncle Al would be coming over later today to keep an eye on you, so please make sure you be a good boy okay. Call us if you need anything.

Love Mom."

'That's right.' You think to yourself, 'Mom and Dad have that company meeting out of town, who knows when they'll be back.'

Normally, most kids would be pretty bummed out about their parents leaving on business. But you got used to it, it's part of their job you always told yourself. Besides, this is a prime oppurtunity, with both parents gone you're home alone...at least until your uncle Al gets here. Personally, you don't have any grudges against the guy, in fact you find him pretty cool, it's just that he has a tendency to act like a total dork sometimes. Still it's better than having some cranky old lady who reeks of cats watch over you.

Entering your house, you quickly lock up the front door and than make your way to your room.

Upon entering, you closed the window blindes and whip out the notebook, ready for your first course of action.

Now, here's a dillema, you are tempted to try this out on yourself. To see if you can make yourself the ultimate badass. Then again, the notebook did comes with a familiar than can probably guide you through this whole "Notebook of Reality" thing. Better safe than dead or worse.
144112.title: Play it safe and go home to try it out.

> For every second he stares at my breasts, make him one inch shorter, until he's six inches tall. <

She laughs to herself one more time, closing the book and putting it between some of her other books about math, bringing them to Jason.

"Oh, I... thought you'll get changed too." Jason states, looking her up and down.

"Nah, I'm good. So, what's the homework about?" Hope says, doing her best to contain the laughter as she walks to Jason, feeling the weight of her cleavage.

"Uuuhhh... I, um, ... l-let me look it up." Jason mumbles, as he starts paging through his notebook. He already seems a bit shorter, and Hope grins at that. "Oh yeah, here it is! It's about trigonometry."

"Mhhmmm," Hope looks into his notebook, displaying her cleavage, and then sees in her peripheral vision how Jason get's shorter and shorter slowly. It works.

Jason starts to do his homeworks as Hope helps him, occasionally stealing a glance or two, still not realizing anything. The first time he realizes that something's wrong is when he looks at his pen in the hand after a couple of minutes. "Hey, is it just me or is that pen a bit too big?"

"What do you mean?" Hope asks. Jason looks her into the face, and realizes that she's much higher than him.

"W-what the-" he says, as he looks down, and starts to shrink rapidly, not being able to tear his eyes away from ever growing cleavage. "W-what's going on?!" Hope giggles and puts her hands around his shrinking figure, lifting it out of clothes. He looks at her big hands, and tries to get out of them, confused. "I don't understand... what- how?!"

"Shhh, it's okay, it's okay." She lifts him up and gives him a hug, pushing him against her big breasts and feeling him still getting smaller and smaller. Once it stops, she holds him for a bit longer, and then puts him into her palm, lifting him up to her face.

"Please... what happened?? Is this a dream?"

"Who's the short stuff now?" She smiles in a sly way, poking his tiny figure with a finger of hers.

"H-how did this happen? Did I... eat something weird? Maybe a drink... I-I can't..." Jason's pacing around Hope's palm, and she finds it very amusing. Though, at the same time... she's starting to doubt this was a good idea. She's considering telling him about her book, or maybe doing something else.
15412221.title: Shrunk by his own perversion

choices: Restore him to his original size
154122211.content:
She goes over him with her hand to try and calm him down. "Look, I'm... sorry, Jason."

"Sorry? What for?" Jason asks, confused but curious.

"I... did this to you. But you kinda did it to yourself."

"Did this to myself? What are you talking about? How? Change me back, please! I can't stay like this!"

She doesn't answer, but instead pulls out the book with no name from between her math books. "This book... it allows me and only me to make anything I write into it true."

Jason doesn't seem to believe it, but stays quiet. Hope just opens the book and shows to him her written wish of making her breasts bigger and teleporting home. "That's why I was wet and in my bikinis. Because I was out swimming, and there I found this book."

"But... what does this have to do with me?"

Hope blushes. "Well... I wanted to have... a bit of fun?"

"How did I do this to myself? Change me back this instant!" Hope consider this and decides to...
154122211.title: Tell truth about the book.

15412221121.content:
"Well, you did have to stare at me in order to shrink, so... I feel like you don't deserve to get back to normal just yet." Fate grins down at the small guy, who seems horrified at the idea of being at the mercy of a giantess. Fate opens her book with no name, at what point Jason starts to panick.
"Please, don't! I won't stare, I swear!"
Fate finishes writing, and Jason feels his clothes shifting around, and morphing.Once he looks down, all he seems to be wearing are just swimming trunks. He covers himself up a bit, and Fate laughs.
"Actually, I don't think this is fair just yet." after a few more scribbles, the swimming trunks morph into bikinis that he awkwardly fills in all the wrong places.
Fate laughs out loud once again. "Alright, you had your fun. Can you please turn me back to normal? This is embarassing!"
"What? This and embarassing? Not by far! Here, I can help you feel more embarassing!"
Once she starts to scribble, Jason makes a run for it, trying to stop her hand. "No, please don't do any more chan-ges!" But it was too late. Jason's voice cracked mid-sentence, as he turned into a she, filling out swimwear properly now.
"Aww, you look so adorable now!" Fate picks the little woman up, who tries to avoid the giant hand but can't. She squirms helplessly in giantess' grip as the pair of giant eyes examines her. "You turned out quite cute. I think you could stay this way!"
The little girl looks at the captor with terrified look. "Please don't! I want to be normal again! Let me go!" she beats against the giant grip, but to no avail.
"Alright, if you're gonna keep protesting, I won't turn you back ever. Just calm down, I want to have some fun with you." Fate tries her best to smile kindly at small girl.

Does 'Jessie' grow to trust her, or panics some more?

1542.content:
Franz, a German guy: He has brown hair and brown eyes, he was the definition of an average guy.

Franz has never been very popular and also not very handsome.
But he had a very caring nature, he always is helping people. He does this at his school and around town with sports, cleaning, and just helping people. Therefore he is well known throughout her city along the coast.

It was a normal Sunday for Franz, after helping out with odd jobs around the city, he decides to go for a swim as there was no more work to do this afternoon.
Besides helping others, one of his favorite tasks is to swim and dive in the ocean that is near his house and school.
Near one side of the beach is a tall cliff that people use as a scenic viewing area. Franz was diving near this cliff when he sees a large overhanging rock fall from the cliff side. It makes a large splash as it hits the water and sinks to the bottom. Once he was sure that it was safe, he dives to where the rock sank, his curiosity getting bigger and bigger…

From a safe distance, he sees that the rock had done some damage where it hit the bottom of the ocean there. He swims towards the rock when he notices something. The rock's fall had opened up what looks like a small cave. Franz checks the opening and it does seem to lead somewhere and that he should be able to fit through it. He goes up for some air and thinks about whether or not he should try to take it. He takes a long breath and dives to the entrance of the cave.

Squeezing through the tunnel, he finds that it goes straight up. He sees light just a little bit further up and he heads for it. He breaks the surface and gasps for air. After catching a breath, he looks around and finds himself in the middle of a decent sized opening with the pool that he was in on one side and some land on the other. Heading for the land, he gets out of the water and looks around some more. There is light seeping in through some cracks in the walls, but it is still dark so it takes a minute or two for his eyes to adjust. Once they do, he finds himself staring at something that is placed in the center of the land in this enclosed area.

A weathered wooden chest was just sitting there. Seeing it, he gets a little excited.

Franz: A....chest!?......A chest hidden in a secret cave that was inside a cliff.....Could there be some sort of treasure inside? No....no. Don't get your hopes up. It is probably empty.....

He kneels in front of the chest and opens it to his surprise, the inside was in pristine condition. There was a luxurious big dark red pillow and a very weird looking book was resting on it. The book was solid black with weird etchings and symbols on it.

Franz reaches for the book.....SEE FIRST PAGE!

He is....stunned....to say the least. No way could this be real, he thinks.....and yet....that twinge of doubt was pulling at the back of his mind....what....what if this is real?

Franz: I-it can’t be.....A magic book that will grant any wish to only me!? But....this place....it was hidden away and I've never heard of a cave in this cliff.....m-maybe it wouldn't hurt to try it.....
1542.title: (13) Franz

155311.content:
A few days ago you noticed the ambulance car, which was later followed by the coroner's vehicle, standing in front of the almost derelict hut where an old, strange fellow lived. Stories about strange things that people had seen, heard or rather imagined were told in the neighborhood by the gossiping females. Men preferred to shake their head but carefully avoided too much contact with the man. He was reported to have once been rich, vital and to have more siblings than normally could be accounted for. What was left of him was carried to the black van in a coffin. Your other business made you forget this episode quickly.

When the doorbell rang you were the quickest one to answer. One of your neighbors told you that they had been told by the city administration that the household would be removed and driven to the city dump. The neighbors were entitled to wander through the little home and take with them what they though would be useful for them. You did not think that the old man possessed anything that would be valuable or interesting for you. But your sheer curiosity made you call a friend and meet in front of the place a few minutes later.

Nobody answered when you knocked on the door and entered the house. Furniture was boring and there was the smell of old age inside the rooms. Just when you thought you had enough you saw a string hanging from the ceiling. When you pulled it a ladder came down that allowed you to move up to the dusty attic. Upon a number of hopelessly useless and damaged items you saw a sailor's trunk. The lid opened with a creak. Below some very old clothes your hands touched cold metal. A metal case was hidden under the layers of stuff. It was locked, of course. The key was nowhere to be found. Where could it be? Had you come across a treasure?
Did you search for the key, take the case and break the lock somewhere else? Or did something else happen?

15531131.content: So you leave the place and leave the case here until you will return with the appropriate tools to open it.

info.description:
This is about someone who found a book that can grant any wish, as long as they write in its infinite pages. Gender, name, and age are decided by you as well as first or third person. No pain or death.

1.no m/m
2.no serious pain. No death. Though monsters, bandits, etc are an exception.
3.No gore,but stuff like scat,digestion,vore is ok if its lite.
4.I can edit/delete as i see fit.
5.Keep entries clean, grammer and stuff like that, mild cussing ok.
6.You can add short entries IF it continues something you have in mind and only if you eventually add a long one that the short ones lead to, and No force endings, you can end, but give an option of continuing before you end the story.
7.You can switch between 1st and 3rd and leave the main character behind, but come back to him/her in the end.
